Articles.Content:
I'm posting the question on this forum, because the ROBLOX Forums are no longer active.

Question:

How do I remove the mouse? I want to use my PC mouse, like the one set in windows I always see. But, I want it to display my current windows mouse, because I have an Assassin's Creed cursor. I want to use that ingame.

36 minutes ago, Mudkip909 said:

 But, I want it to display my current windows mouse, because I have an Assassin's Creed cursor. I want to use that ingame.

Danny? As a Roblox player, I'm disappointed Ted that I do not know the awnser. Sorry bro

12 hours ago, Mudkip909 said:

I'm posting the question on this forum, because the ROBLOX Forums are no longer active.

Question:

How do I remove the mouse? I want to use my PC mouse, like the one set in windows I always see. But, I want it to display my current windows mouse, because I have an Assassin's Creed cursor. I want to use that ingame.

Since Roblox is an online MMO game that is hard to mod/hack, i don't know if there is a way to replace the cursor. There is a possibily you can sneak into the configs, but i have no idea.

10 hours ago, NSEP said:

Since Roblox is an online MMO game that is hard to mod/hack, i don't know if there is a way to replace the cursor. There is a possibily you can sneak into the configs, but i have no idea.

Weird note: the 'Oof' sound is listed as 'uuhhh' in the Roblox files.

You might be kicked if you tried to edit the files. I'm sad I can't replace every sound with 'Pootis'.

12 minutes ago, Kernel Kraken said:

Weird note: the 'Oof' sound is listed as 'uuhhh' in the Roblox files.

I honestly can't hear 'Oof' in the classical sound. Its always 'uuhhh' for me.

Maybe its not weird at all. Whatever.

If there are Roblox files you can edit, an manage to find the cursor, im 100% sure you can replace the in-game cursor with your own.

15 minutes ago, NSEP said:

I honestly can't hear 'Oof' in the classical sound. Its always 'uuhhh' for me.

Maybe its not weird at all. Whatever.

 

For me it's been more like an 'UhhOuuurrrfdffffff', but when moving fast at the time of death (which causes the pitch to be distorted according to the speed at death) it seems more of an 'Oof'.

Edited April 26, 2018 by Kernel Kraken
Death appearently autocorrects to delivery. Who woulda thunk it?

3 minutes ago, Kernel Kraken said:

For me it's been more like an 'UhhOuuurrrfdffffff', but when moving fast at the time of delivery (which causes the pitch to be distorted according to the speed at death) it seems more of an 'Oof'.

I wonder how they got the sound.

Anyways, this is getting kind of off-topic.
